(COPY FOE YOUR INFORMATION)
THE BEACON PRESS
25 BEACON STREET
BOSTON B, MASSACHUSETTS
May 4, 1953
Mr® Seymour Siegel
WNYC
Municipal Building
New York 7, N.Y.
Dear Seymour:
You probably have received my letter—which crossed yours
in the mails—reporting that THE JEFFERSONIAN HERITAGE
is now in the bindery—with copies expected this week*
Walter Goldschmidt has been hard at work on THE WAYS
OF MANKIND, and has been writing a 30,000-word running
essay into which the scripts will be fitted* This is
an extraordinary piece of work, and will provide a very
helpful continuity for the radio material. Dr. Goldschmidt
had expected to have his new material—which is virtually
a small book in itself—completed before this; but has had
to delay the delivery date until later this month. Mean¬
while he has selected a competent artist with an anthrop¬
ological background to prepare illustrations to be used
throughout the book. As you can see, THE WAYS OF MANKIND
will be an even more elaborate piece of book production
than THE JEFFERSONIAN HERITAGE*
PEOPLE UNDER COMMUNISM is requiring mu‘ch more work within
the scripts themselves than has been required on either
the Jefferson or the anthropology book. We are working
with three key advisers of the Russian Research Center at
Harvard and in a few weeks will come up with a detailed
recommendation for consolidating some of the material and
possibly for enlarging the whole project to include both
the book and a series of pamphlets—drawing on both the
hour-long programs and the half-hour-long scripts.
Pocketbooks, Inc. has put in a tentative bid for the re¬
print lights on THE JEFFERSONIAN HERITAGE.
It’s wonderful to know that there is a possibility of
overseas publications. I think the dignity of your office
requires the services of an assistant the next time you
go to a meeting in Paris....
With very best wishes.
Ever cordially,
(Signed) Melvin Arnold
